knimeNode.name: Expand Barcode
knimeNode.shortDescription: Expands a barcode column into several columns containing barcode-coded meta information.

intro.p: This nodes takes a string column and appends the information content of the barcode string into several new columns (e.g. library code, library plate number, project code, assay, date, replicate).

The node uses a regular expression that tries to match the barcode column. Possible barcode patterns can be set at:
KNIME->Preferences->KNIME->HCS-Tools->Barcode patterns

This is an example:
(?<libplatenumber>[0-9]{3})(?<projectcode>[A-z]{2})(?<date>[0-9]{6})(?<replicate>[A-z]{1})-(?<libcode>[_A-z\d]{3})(?<assay>[-_+\s\w\d]*)
Each wanted meta information is marked as a named group and results in a new column. Definition pattern:
(?<groupname>regular expression)
The group name will be the name of the new column, beside a few exceptions:

fullDescription.option:
If activated, the node tries to find the best matching pattern from all available barcode patterns.
If deactivated, the user need to select one of the barcode patterns.

ports.outPort: Input table with additional columns containing barcode metadata.
